alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate waves of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall moving across northern and central Chatham Counties, including the Savannah Metro Area. As much 2 inches of rain has fallen so far today and an additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 730 PM. Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas is likely. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Richmond Hill, Hunter Army Airfield, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Windsor Forest, Downtown Savannah, Savannah International Airport, Midtown Savannah, Coffee Bluff, Hutchinson Island, Godley Station, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Bloomingdale, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg, White Bluff and Burroughs.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
